question: Morning. Startled, Drew shoots herself in the eye with the water pick. Parker's ENTERED from her side. Drew shuts off the water pick, dries her face. Why the young executive look?
answer: I have my interview at NYU today. Parker, sleepy, stretches, unaware she's exposing her new belly ring. No way Mom knows about that. Self-consciously, Parker drops her arms, pulls her shirt down.

question: And she never will. At least until after I'm married.
answer: Didn't it hurt?

question: Like hell. Drew shivers.
answer: Piercings are so... unhygienic. A little BEEP BEEP from her preset WATCH ALARM goes off. Breakfast. Drew turns on her heel and EXITS. When Parker sets her Blackberry down we get our first glimpse of... ... HER SIDE OF THE BATHROOM which resembles a post- apocalyptic toiletry landscape. There's a very clear line of demarcation on the counter like the demilitarized zone separating the Koreas. Parker reaches among the rubble for her toothbrush but notices another message on her Blackberry

question: Hellooo, Warren. Distracted, Parker drops her toothbrush, which bounces off the counter and PLOPS into the toilet. ON THE TOILET BOWL -- there it is, slowly sinking. Parker is stone-faced. She looks to her sister's side of the counter where a fresh brush sits in the flowered holder. She's considering... she's reaching... then... nah. Instead, she squeezes the tube straight into her mouth, brushes with a finger and spits.
answer: Morning, Dad.

question: Morning, Dad.
answer: Morning, baby.

question: How's the book coming?
answer: Well, sweety, my writing process is a lot like a giant hydroelectric dam. For a long time I just let the great ideas build up and build up until the sheer weight of them spills over and the words just come pouring out.

question: Still stuck, huh?
answer: Not a word. Parker ENTERS with her Blackberry in hand, smooches her pop, then takes a sat. Parker's clearly a chip off her Dad's block. Both pour milk first into their bowl, then Charley drops in Super Sugar Crisp while Parker pours in Count Chocula. Both hit 'em with a couple of spoons of extra sugar. Mom takes a seat, too, primly eating a piece of dry wheat toast that she slices in half first. Like Mom, like Drew. Drew spots the BLACKBERRY JPEG of Warren before Parker can turn it over.

question: Time to go.
answer: Come on, honey! Let's tear up Manhattan! With a shiver, Drew closes the book, looks up into the mirror, takes a squirt off her inhaler to calm herself and tries some self-reassurance.

question: You're smart. You're resourceful. You'll find a way to make it work. She tries to sell herself on this by smiling, but something in the smile suggests SHE'S SCREWED. Collecting her Dayplanner, purse, interview file and cell phone, she drops them into her matching Coach shoulder bag.
answer: Doctor MacLeod... I'm sorry, but my itinerary is booked solid today. Call Dr. Wessels. He's covering for me. He did? Are you sure it's the baby's head? All right. I'm coming. Frustrated, Mom hangs up and with a look of profound disappointment, turns to Drew. I'm sorry, hon. It's a Blue Light special in Maternity. Every bed's full and some poor woman is about to give birth in the gift shop. I have to go in. Drew musters her best sad, sad face for her mom.

question: Ah, darn it, Mom. That's a shame. It's like fate is conspiring against us.
answer: I know.

question: You absolutely, positively have to promise me we'll do it another time.
answer: I promise. I better hurry. Have Parker drop you at the train station on her way to school, will you? Quinn gives her daughter a smile and a kiss. Kill 'em in that interview.

question: Mom, you know, I might not get in.
answer: Are you kidding me? You're Drew MacLeod. Nobody's smarter, nobody works harder and nobody, and I mean nobody, is ever more prepared. Drew smiles, hugs her mom and jumps out, waving as her mom backs down the drive and disappears down the street. With the weight of the world suddenly lifted from her shoulders, Drew looks to the sky and mouths, "thank you." This is when Parker comes hauling down the driveway in her Honda Accord. Drew signals her to stop, so of course her sister IGNORES HER and jets into the street.

question: Hey! Stop! Drew takes off running after the car! PARKER!!
answer: Good luck with your interview. Drew pauses, holding the door open.

question: You know, Parker. Chemistry is important. When you think about it, everything's made of chemicals.
answer: Oh, I'm interested in chemistry. Just not the kind with all the numbers and stinky test tubes. Drew shuts the door and hustles off into the train station. Parker SIGHS, looks to the BLACKBERRY on the seat next to her. Ah, chemistry.

question: Professor Spaulding. Good afternoon. I'm Drew MacLeod. An EXECUTIVE takes the aisle seat next to her, and after a sideways glance at Drew's portable office, opens his Wall Street Journal as the train begins to pull away. EVERY COMMUTER is quietly reading the paper or staring off into their own world, wondering why their life has lead them to this sad moment when... ... they're all distracted by an AWFUL, AWFUL VOICE singing Sheryl Crow's "Soak Up the Sun." It's Parker, wearing her headphones and looking for a seat in the full train car. Drew stares at her, dumbfounded. What do you think you're doing?
answer: Looking for a seat.

question: This can't be happening. Wait, I know. This is one of those Ground Hog Day dreams, isn't it? Drew pinches herself too hard. Ow! I'm awake now. You're supposed to disappear.
answer: You know, I just got this itch.

question: Then scratch it and get back to school.
answer: I couldn't concentrate anyway. I'm too... distracted today.

question: You're permanently distracted. It's called Attention Deficit Disorder. Is this about that chat room guy? It is, isn't it? A look from the Exec reminds Parker of her headphones and she pulls them off.
answer: No! It's about spontaneity, which you obviously wouldn't know anything about.

question: I swear to God, Parker, you go through boyfriends like Junior Mints. It's pathetic.
answer: Pathetic? You want to talk about pathetic?! At least I don't count getting accidentally felt up in dodge ball as my first date! You're going to be eighteen and you've never even HAD a boyfriend! The EXECUTIVE furrows his brow at Drew -- never?

question: Is this any of your business? He goes back to his paper. This is ridiculous. I don't have time for this today. Fine. Don't graduate from high school. Make a mess of your life over some complete stranger. I don't care. But leave me out. I have something important I need to accomplish today, so please go away. I have to mentally preview my day now. I can't talk anymore. Parker turns to go, then remembers something.
answer: Uh, Drew? Do you have any money? I don't have enough for a ticket. Drew just rolls her eyes and turns her back on her sister. The Executive peers over his spectacles at Parker with the old paternal reprimand look. Please. Like you never ditched school. CUT TO: 'You don't know how you met me...' But when she spots the CONDUCTOR ENTERING the front of the car, she abruptly stops, slips down in he seat and slides past the COMMUTER LADY next to her into the aisle. Excuse me. Parker heads the opposite direction from the ticket- taking Conductor and out the back of the train car.

question: Very funny.
answer: Excuse me?

question: Let's go. He takes her by the arm.
answer: What are you doing? Drew scrambles to grab her bag, jacket, the little inflatable lap desk falling to the floor.

question: I tried to be nice about it, but if you want the police involved, this is the way to do it.
answer: Police? I didn't do anything.

question: No ticket, no train ride.
answer: No! That's not me! That was my twin sister you threw off!

question: Young lady, in thirty years I have heard every possible line but that's the lamest ever.
answer: She's right there! I'm... ouch.

question: She's fine, considering she should be in jail. As the Conductor escorts her down the stairs, she and Dream Guy share a last look before she's... ... left on the platform just as the train's pulling out. Still no sign of Parker and Drew doesn't have all her wits about her.
answer: This can't be happening! I have a... a... little paper thingy. What are they called? Ticket! I have a ticket! It's right... She drops her bag, contents spilling willy-nilly. On her hands and knees, she frantically searches for her ticket in the mess. The Conductor, however, is already on the train stop as it pulls away. He just waves, victorious. Parker steps back out onto the platform and the Conductor spots her. He looks from one sister to the other -- oops, mistake. But it's too late. Sheepishly, he climbs inside and the train is gone. AARRGGH! PARRR... KERRR! Parker steps up from behind her.

question: This can't be happening! I have a... a... little paper thingy. What are they called? Ticket! I have a ticket! It's right... She drops her bag, contents spilling willy-nilly. On her hands and knees, she frantically searches for her ticket in the mess. The Conductor, however, is already on the train stop as it pulls away. He just waves, victorious. Parker steps back out onto the platform and the Conductor spots her. He looks from one sister to the other -- oops, mistake. But it's too late. Sheepishly, he climbs inside and the train is gone. AARRGGH! PARRR... KERRR! Parker steps up from behind her.
answer: You get kicked off, too? Why didn't you just buy a ticket? Parker stoops to help collect a couple of things but Drew, mad at hell, swats her hand away.

question: Don't.
answer: What happened to your head?

question: Oh, just a minor concussion I sustained while the Conductor was throwing me off the train because he thought I was you sneaking back on the train!
answer: Sorry.

question: I'll bet. Drew throws her bag over her shoulder and heads for the ticket counter. The WELT on her forehead is gonna be a doozey.
answer: I am! Where are you going?

question: To see when the next train leaves.
answer: I already -- But Drew's inside the stationhouse. -- did. They said something about a delay. Parker follows into the stationhouse.

question: That can't be. I have to be there before two! What did you just say?
answer: Come on. Hurry. I got us a ride.

question: Let go of my arm. But Parker drags her away. Drew shoots a look back at the Clerk, who sticks out his tongue at her. What's this?
answer: A car service.

question: Morning, miss.
answer: Good morning. Thank you. My sister's coming, too. Drew KNOWS SOME SKETCHY SHIT IS GOING DOWN buy she's only got this instant to consider. She glances at the STRANDED MOB descending on a lone approaching CAB, engulfing it. You want to make that interview, or not? Drew lets herself be pulled inside. Bennie shuts the door and waddles around to his side.

question: So you're headed to the Teamster's Hall on Second Street?
answer: You know, Mister... She checks his Chauffeur's License up front ... Loyola.

question: Bennie.
answer: Mr. Bennie? We have a slight change of itinerary. We need to go into Manhattan. 57th and 5th will be fine. Bennie doesn't seem perturbed a bit.

question: Pre-paid? What's 57th and 5th?
answer: Barneys.

question: Not Barneys.
answer: We've got five hours. Relax. He FIRES UP the LINCOLN and off they go. Drew now has a pretty clear inclination as to what's going on. She leans into her sister and WHISPERS.

question: This was supposed to be someone else's car, wasn't it?
answer: So? Just then, Bennie tosses the sign, which he'd stashed on the dash, onto the seat next to him, face up so Drew can read:

question: 'Scarpelli'? We're supposed to be Italian?
answer: Northern Italian.

question: This is so... wrong.
answer: What? You need to get to that interview. We now have a ride. We will pay for the ride. End of big deal. This is when Bennie's CELL PHONE RINGS and he answers it.

question: He's stuck at the light! VRROOOM! Here comes the Lincoln storming around the corner.
answer: He has no respect for traffic laws! They run into the first ALLEY and hunker down by a GARBAGE CAN. The Lincoln flies past. They dash back out, the same way they came. SCREECH! Bennie LOCKS UP the WHEELS! They round the same corner going the opposite way and Parker pulls them into the first door... Is he gone? I can't believe this. What did you get us into?

question: We lost him. Wow. That was a rush.
answer: A rush? Are you out of your mind?

question: I don't have any change, but here. Parker starts to find the Homeless Guy a dollar but Drew reaches over to stop her...
answer: Parker, you're only feeding the poor man's disease. Buy him a healthy snack. ... just as the Homeless Guy reaches for the dollar and the SLUSHEE IS KNOCKED FROM HIS HAND. We watch in SLOW MOTION AS THE SLUSHEE TAKES FLIGHT, THE CAP FALLING OFF AND THE STICKY, CHERRY RED MESS FANNING

question: Ew. That stinks. That's not just Slushee. The MINI-MART CLERK approaches them, shaking his head. May we use your bathroom please? The cherry syrup and cheap wine concoction drips down Drew's blank face. That's what I keep telling her. Everything's going to be fine. Peek-a-boo! We're practically there. We'll get you cleaned up, you'll get into the program and... Peek-a-boo! ... we'll both look back on this and laugh our butts off. BLECCH! The BABY PUKES all over Drew. She looks sideways at her sister.
answer: I will never, ever, forgive you.

question: See? New York. We made it.
answer: I could be arrested for vagrancy looking like this.

question: Listen. I've got an idea.
answer: No. No ideas. I'm going straight to that interview and wait, without moving or speaking, especially to you, for four hours.

question: Come on! We're going to the Plaza! We can be Eloise! We'll get a nice room, you can take a shower and I'll swap clothes with you! Simple as that!
answer: Do you have the slightest clue what that would cost?

question: So? You've got the emergency credit card Mom gave you, right? Drew's suddenly looking at her EMPTY HANDS. What's wrong?
answer: Oh. My. God.

question: Where's your, uh, stuff?
answer: I left it in his car.

question: Oh.
answer: He knows where I live. He's going to hunt me down and kill me.

question: Come on, Drew. I don't think even the Mafia kills people just for scamming a ride. Quit being paranoid. So, we don't do the Plaza. I've got... Parker digs in her pockets. Six dollars and thirty-two cents.
answer: That won't get me hosed down at a car wash.

question: What are we thinking? You've got your secret-safety twenty!
answer: My secret-safety twenty. Of course. But it's only for emergencies. Yeah. Drew takes off her shoe, lifts the inner sole and pulls out a twenty, then realizes: Hey, how'd you know about my secret-safety twenty?

question: That's not important now. But let's just say that it's a good thing for you I think those shoes are so ugly I never borrowed them. Hey, how about there? Parker points to hotel where the dilapidated sign reads
answer: No. I want to get clean, not contract hepatitis.

question: Twenty-six dollars and thirty-six cents.
answer: We touch nothing. Parker leads them inside.

question: Hello? Anybody?
answer: Keep your pants on. What'dya want? The girls look behind them, nobody. Behind the bars? Still nobody. What the hell? I don't got all day.

question: We need a room... with a shower. Just for an hour. There's the sound of something SCRAPING across the floor and then the MIDGET HOTEL CLERK appears behind the counter. Now he's standing on a STOOL and we don't know what he was doing behind the counter.
answer: Sixty bucks.

question: Hi.
answer: You want the room or not?

question: -- really nice place. How much for half an hour.
answer: Maybe if you two were in school you could figure out that half a sixty is thirty.

question: We've only got twenty-five.
answer: You think because I'm short you can just charm me into making some deal, is that it?

question: It's all we have. Twenty-six dollars and thirty-six cents.
answer: Are you the one that stinks so bad?

question: I had a little accident, okay?
answer: All right, all right, don't get your underwear in a bunch. As a public service, just 'cause you stink so bad, you can have it for twenty-five. He retrieves a key and holds it up just out of reach between the bars. Ten-dollar deposit on key.

question: Man, that little guy could really motor. Why'd you bolt?
answer: There was a rat, Parker. A rat the size of a Doberman eating my foot.

question: That was all our money.
answer: Our money? OUR MONEY?!

question: Key down, you're going to have an attack.
answer: Parker, it was not 'our' money and this is not 'our' day in New York. What it is, is quite possibly the most important day of my life. I've resigned myself to the fact that you don't give a crap about what you do with yours, but if you could find it in your heart, your tiny, cold steel heart, to respect what this means to me, I would appreciate it. But Parker's not listening. She's staring intently... ... ACROSS THE STREET where several TOWN CARS are parked, the DRIVERS chatting next to a HOT DOG/PRETZEL CART. Among them is Bennie, sipping coffee. Parker spots him and freezes. You're not even listening. That's typical. Look, we're splitting up. Give me back my secret safety money.

question: You know how I told you not to be paranoid?
answer: Paranoid?

question: What I meant was, it isn't paranoia if someone really is chasing you. Parker tries to subtly indicate with her eyes that Drew should look across the street.
answer: What's wrong with your eyes?

question: It's him. Quiet. Don't run. He'll see us. Not wanting to draw his attention, the Girls shuffle off quickly down the street. ON Bennie -- squinting across at them. Can he make them out in the crowd? He nods to ANOTHER DRIVER, tosses his coffee cup and climbs in behind the wheel.
answer: HE SAW US! The girls break into a run. How'd he find us?

question: Maybe it's just coincidence!
answer: Or maybe WE TOLD HIM WHERE WE WERE GOING!! She points up at the street sign -- 57th and 5th. Oops.

question: Come on! Parker leads her into traffic, HORNS BLARING, as they weave their way across. On the far side, a HORSE CARRIAGE pulls away from the curb and at the last minute, Parker spots a fresh pile of... ... HORSE SHIT, which she manages to leap. Drew, however, ISN'T GOING TO MAKE IT OVER. She closes her eyes. Jump! Drew stumbles, wrong-foots the takeoff but somehow manages to get across it to the curb. For just a BEAT, we see her surprised face. Hm. I did it. Then they see Bennie crossing in traffic, huffing and puffing after them and not seeing the pile, which he hits in full stride, slips on, and PLOPS INTO on his ass. This gives the girls the opening they need and they ditch inside some revolving doors.
answer: I don't want to do this anymore. I want to be done. No more rats, no more mob hit men.

question: Well, Cinderella, your wish has come true. Voila, La Plaza, mademoiselle.
answer: So? Hello? No dinero?

question: Yeah. I've got what I'd like to call a 'creative solution' to that.
answer: No. I'm calling Mom.

question: What good will that do?
answer: I'll have her... uh...

question: Have her what? Hi, Mom? Could you leave that baby halfway outta there and drive into the city?
answer: Dad, then.

question: Dad, hey. Drew. Complete loser. Couldn't get to an interview by myself, need full bail out. Yeah. I'm the one who was going to change the world, I just couldn't get across town.
answer: Damn it, Parker, my itinerary is shot to hell! Blue, red -- Her WATCH ALARM BEEPS. I don't even know what that means! I'm running out of time. Is that guy looking at me? Parker starts to look. Don't look.

question: When you ask a question like that, the person is going to look. Drew drags her behind a palm. Sure enough, across the lobby, a guy dressed as PLAINCLOTHES HOTEL SECURITY now pretends he wasn't keeping an eye on them.
answer: I think he was.

question: Drew, we haven't done anything.
answer: Yeah, but I'm standing in the lobby of the Plaza looking like a deranged street person who might attack at any moment. In fact, I might attack at any moment. The ELEVATOR behind them opens.

question: Let's go. The girls slip into the elevator. When it closes, Morty's watching.
answer: What are we doing? And why am I whispering?

question: We're getting you a shower. Blake Greer pulled this at the Sheraton after the prom.
answer: Great. Now we're emulating Blake Greer, voted most likely to commit a felony before having to shave.

question: We're not going to steal anything. We're just going to sneak in, use a little soap and water and get out.
answer: Oh, we're not going to steal anything. Super. Just a little 'breaking and entering.'

question: We're not going to break anything. We are going to enter, however.
answer: No. No. No.

question: Hurry up!
answer: No!

question: I didn't want to have to do this, but... look in the mirror behind you. ON DREW -- bracing herself, she turns slowly. CUT TO: Housekeeping? CUT TO:
answer: I can't do this.

question: Drew, you're not a criminal. You just smell like one. This way.
answer: Oh, no. Oh my god. A... a... What the hell is it?

question: A dog?
answer: I'm itching already. See? Are my arms red? Drew backs away -- she's about to break for the door.

question: That's not your dog! Hey!
answer: There's a man in there!

question: Somebody took the dog! They reach the end of the hallway and are TRAPPED. Only one out. Parker HUFFS OPEN the window to the fire escape and they climb out... Hurry up! But DREW'S FROZEN WITH FEAR and to complicate matters, she's struggling to keep the curtain wrapped around herself.
answer: I'll, uh, go around.

question: This is Remote One to base, Remote One to base. Code 12, I repeat, Code 12.
answer: You goin' to lunch already, Morty?

question: Code 12 isn't lunch, Bruce! Didn't you read your manual?
answer: I will. A what?

question: Just call the damn police and patch me through. The Emperor's been kidnapped.
answer: Holy cripes, why didn't you say it was political?!

question: Political? THE EMPEROR IS A DOG, MORON!
answer: You want me to call NYPD about a dog?

question: I can't do it!
answer: Yes you can!

question: No I can't!
answer: Have fun in prison. Under 'Summer Internships' on your college application, you can write 'license plate manufacturing.'

question: I did it. Oops, the curtain starts to slip. When she reaches for it she loses her balance and suddenly -- FWONK -- nosedives into the dumpster. The curtain floats INTO THE ALLEY at Parker's feet. OW!
answer: Get out of there!

question: He thinks we have the dog!
answer: A painter took it!

question: A pain -- WHAM! -- Drew's CLOTHESLINED at the intersection by a BIKE MESSENGER who, in a valiant attempt to avoid her, brakes so hard he flies off the handlebars and lands
answer: Hey, complete stranger! Get off my sister! Parker yanks Drew from underneath Dream Guy.

question: I'm, uh, late for this place, thing, where I'm supposed to be. College. Interview! NYU! ... before disappearing into the CROWD on the sidewalk. Why does this not surprise me? THE NEXT MUSIC CUE COMES UP and the SHOWRUNNER grabs Drew... Excuse me, but I'm supposed to be going to my college interview.
answer: The hotel guy's here. The juxtaposition of the TWO POLAR OPPOSITE OUTFITS draped over twins suddenly throws the audience into PAROXYSMS OF APPRECIATION for the inspiration of the artist and they call him out! Bobo! BOBO! AUTEUR! BRAVA! Here comes a smiling Bobo, through the curtains, blowing kisses and heading for the girls. And the police. Bobo presses himself between the girls, taking their hands and beginning his bows, but the girls spot Morty peeking from backstage, and they TAKE OFF, leaping off the front of the stage into the audience like punks jumping into the mosh pit.

question: They couldn't have gone very far. We'll split up. You go that way! You take Fifth! Come on, get on your horse! Morty and Bruce take the cop's order and race off in separate directions. Neither Hogan nor his partner moves.
answer: Coffee?

question: Sure. Williamson and Hogan step over to a hot dog cart set up next to a NEWSPAPER STAND.
answer: Two black.

question: Where do you think those two went?
answer: Beats me. They didn't have any stupid dog with them from what I could see.

question: Might have stashed it.
answer: Maybe they ate it. The cops giggle at this. The rent-a-cop said the mutt's worth like 50 G's. That makes it grand theft, my friend. Five to ten.

question: Are you listening to me?! Give me that stupid thing! Drew reaches for the Blackberry.
answer: Knock it off, Drew! This guy might be able to help. He lives here.

question: Parker, you have completely lost your mind if you can be thinking about boys at a time like this! THOREAU 786
answer: The United Nations?

question: You can't possibly know somebody who works at the United Nations. Maybe he meant United Sub Sandwiches. Or United Skate Rats Store. NOTATWIN
answer: So. We're going to the United Nations to use the restroom.

question: How convenient. You arrange a little date while your sister's future hangs in the balance.
answer: Look, he said he'd help and it's only a couple blocks away. You got a better idea? Speedy opens the rear door of the newsstand.

question: We're going to make it, Drew. You'll see. There's still plenty of time. You'll get cleaned up, we can trade clothes... this is a nice suit, huh? Right?
answer: Yes.

question: You're going to get accepted, then we can explain the misunderstanding about the dog to the police and everything will be okay.
answer: Maybe after the police forgive us for sneaking into someone else's hotel room, we can ask them to please keep the mob hit man from whacking us and dropping us into the marina so he doesn't get his suit dirty.

question: First things first.
answer: Parker, I know you're trying to cheer me up, but I have to be honest. This is all your fault.

question: My fault? MY FAULT?! I didn't mean for any of this to happen!
answer: Yeah, right! Like you didn't mean to ask Bernie Lipscomb to the prom!

question: What's that supposed to mean?
answer: I'll bet that was just another accident of yours that happened to screw up my life!

question: Bernie Lipscomb? You...? Drew didn't want to admit that -- it just slipped out under pressure. You liked Bernie, too?
answer: You know I did!

question: No I didn't. I haven't seen you talk to a guy since we were in kindergarten and we thought Jerry Wester was a girl.
answer: You asked Bernie just to snake him from me!

question: 605, do you still have visual? POLICEMAN #2 Negative. But they can't be far. They're on foot.
answer: That's over by the U.N.

question: See if you can pick them up. We're on our way. Zoom! Williamson blasts crosstown. CUT TO:
answer: There they are.

question: What's wrong with going out there?
answer: Police, for one thing.

question: Police? I thought you guys were joking.
answer: It's the kind of joke that will be a lot funnier a few years from now.

question: Are you okay?
answer: Ohhh... I'm so sick. The mussels at lunch. You have to help me.

question: I'm kind of in my own private hell right now.
answer: What's your name?

question: Drew.
answer: Drew... it's vitally important. A FILE FOLDER comes skidding from under the stall. Please. You have to take this to Canada.

question: Uh, Canada? It's sort of far away.
answer: In the Assembly. Give the file to Mr. Wakefield, the Canadian representative. Please. I can't... get up.

question: You want me to take this to the Canadian Representative to the United Nations?
answer: Hurry! This is a crisis! What can she possibly do?

question: Okay. Drew EXITS the stall and goes to the door. Where's the Assembly?
answer: To the left. Run! Drew peeks out the door. It looks clear. Out she goes. CUT TO:

question: Jin zshe miya BRAD PITT! SCREAMING LIKE BANSHEES, the Japanese Girls all pour outside, Warren and the Girls following. Dingo cashito, BRAD PITT ezukai! The JAPANESE GIRLS turn around and STORM BACK THROUGH THE DOORS, blocking Williamson and Hogan's EXIT. The three of them run for the line of taxis.
answer: You speak Japanese?

question: I may not look like an underwear model, but I'm smarter than a hundred of them put together. Warren grabs a Taxi door. Come on!
answer: We don't have any money!

question: I'm smart AND rich! Williamson and Hogan have fought their way out through the little Japanese Girls. Realizing they won't reach Parker and Drew in time, they head for their own unmarked cruiser which is parked just ahead of... Bennie's TOWN CAR. He's holding the door for a cigar- chewing CLIENT but watching the Girls climb into the cab up ahead.
answer: Follow that... uh...

question: I told you, I didn't know you liked him! It was no big deal!
answer: It was to me!

question: How could I know? You never tell me anything!
answer: There's a good reason for that!

question: What's that supposed to mean?
answer: You know very well what it means, Ms. Big Mouth!

question: Big mouth?! Ooh, I hope you miss that stupid interview!
answer: Oh yeah? Well, the joke's on you, because there isn't any interview! Oops. This just slipped out in anger. Parker's brain has to adjust, then:

question: What?
answer: No interview. I screwed up.

question: You screwed up what?
answer: Scheduling the interview. You deaf?

question: You're Drew. Drew doesn't screw ANYTHING up, let alone scheduling. You're the Iron Chef of scheduling.
answer: I missed the deadline.

question: How?
answer: After they made the first cut from the preliminary application, we were supposed to send in a form to secure our interview time and I filled it out and had everything ready to go in the mailbox and then... Drew is near tears.

question: And then what? Earthquake? Tsunami? Nuclear winter?
answer: I forgot.

question: Forgot?
answer: Yes. I just forgot. When I found it in my bag a week later, I'd missed the deadline.

question: So today? All this? What are you doing?
answer: I... I was going to try to meet Professor Spaulding and...

question: Did one of them just get out?
answer: I think so. Maybe she's going for the dog.

question: Maybe that's what they want us to think.
answer: So we stay with the taxi?

question: Unless you want to hoof it after the other one.
answer: We stay with the taxi.

question: Get in the back, will ya? The Emperor ignores him, happily watching the streets of New York go by. Stupid dog. But his CALL has gone through. He imitates a GIRL'S Hello? CUT TO:
answer: Yes? Morty and Bruce have their tracing gear rigged to her phone but have to keep following her around the box.

question: If you want to see your dog alive again, listen closely. I want a hundred thousand dollars transferred into this numbered Swiss account --
answer: -- I'll give you ten grand but only if he's in Madison Square Garden in... She looks to her husband, who consults his watch and then holds up ONE FINGER. One hour. Take it or leave it. Bruce SIGNALS her -- keep him on the line! You have one minute to decide. She hangs up. Bruce and Morty SIGH.

question: Yesss?
answer: Okay. Here's how we make the --

question: -- First of all, you forgot to disguise your voice.
answer: Damn it!

question: Secondly, my husband will meet you in ten minutes on the corner of 43rd and Broadway. He'll have the money. Bring the dog.
answer: But that's ridiculous! You'll just bring the police! No way! Consider him Kung Pau!

question: Fine.
answer: Don't hang up!

question: The police, it appears, have other priorities, like humans or something. And I assure you, the Hotel Security... people... will not interfere. In any case, little man, we just want the dog back before showtime, do you understand?
answer: Okay.

question: Ciao. She hangs up. Roger does, too.
answer: No wonder you look so happy. As far as you're concerned, you've escaped from the Wicked Witch of the West. Knock it off. Whoosh! From behind, DREW GRABS THE EMPEROR and takes off running. Hey! Give me that dog! Holding The Emperor at arm's length, Drew makes a run for it with Roger after her.

question: Not now, Warren. Drew was going to be late even though technically she wasn't going to be late since there wasn't an interview and that's when we got in your car. I promise we meant to pay. It was a true emergency.
answer: I meant, why you runnin' when I'm trying to give you your bag back? Bennie hands Parker Drew's daybag. Parker takes it, still trying to comprehend.

question: You were just...?
answer: I found your mom's number in the book. She said you needed it pretty badly for that big interview. Listen, I gotta go. It's my mother-in-law's birthday and I gotta plant some stupid rose bush and then take her out to dinner at the Pier. See ya around. Bennie waddles over to his Town Car and climbs in.

question: It's all yours. She hands the high heel to Red, who enthusiastically pulls it on and models it.
answer: MacLeod? Hogan ENTERS, opens the cell door. You're free to go.

question: No thanks. I'll just stay here with the girls.
answer: An eyewitness says he saw who took the dog. Didn't realize the guy was stealing it until he saw us grab you. Hogan takes her by the arm in a fatherly way and leads her out. There's your alibi.

question: I don't even know him.
answer: That's what he said. Go home. Get cleaned up, a good night's sleep. None of this will seem so bad in the morning. Hogan leaves them alone. Bike Guy steps over.

question: Thanks, Jim. How'd you know?
answer: Who could forget that face? Reminded, Drew puts a hand to her face.

question: Huh. No hives. Suddenly, realizing just how awful she must look, Drew becomes self-conscious. Well... bye. She walks past him out the door.
answer: Wait. Where are you going?

question: Thanks for getting me out of jail but I have to go home now because my entire life is ruined.
answer: Bad day, huh?

question: You turn understatement into an art.
answer: Can you just tell me your name? Please?

question: I'm Drew MacLeod. The girl who won't be going to the NYU Accelerated Program.
answer: Why not? Drew looks at her watch.

question: Because short of flying, there's no way to get from here to NYU in five minutes.
answer: Sure there is. CUT TO:

question: Wow. And I thought I was anal.
answer: This is no good. I don't do too well with the whole rehearsal thing. I'm more of a 'wing it' person. Parker checks herself in her reflection in the glass. Working herself into Drew form, she puts her hair into a conservative bun and then tries straightening her posture. How's this look? Drewish?

question: You know, I've always had a thing for librarians.
answer: Warren, honesty is fine. But you could edit a little, you know?

question: Got it.
answer: Wish me luck.

question: Good luck, Drew. CUT TO:
answer: I'm here to see Professor Spaulding. Um, no. However... Professor Spaulding?

question: I'm here to see Professor Spaulding. Um, no. However... Professor Spaulding?
answer: Yes?

question: May I have a moment of your time?
answer: I'm sorry, but I have a plane to catch. He tries to make a move. Parker blocks him.

question: I know. But this is very important.
answer: What is this about?

question: Life and death, if you must know. The Professor hesitates for just an instant, giving Parker her opening. She grabs his hand, giving it a vigorous, Young Republican shake. I'm Drew MacLeod.
answer: Ms. MacLeod, I hope this is interesting.

question: ... I didn't think you'd make it. I knew I wouldn't be any good at it, but I figured at least there was a chance.
answer: That's... sweet.

question: You're not mad?
answer: No.

question: I'm so sorry for today.
answer: It's okay. But let's talk about it later.

question: Thank you.
answer: Parker, consider, just for a moment, whether this is the appropriate time and place.

question: Okay, I considered. What I want to say is, I didn't purposefully set out to ruin your day, but that doesn't mean I'm not a little... jealous.
answer: Jealous?

question: I just mean, maybe, even if I don't intend to, maybe that jealousy, you know, gets in the way sometimes.
answer: You mean subliminally you're undermining me?

question: I don't know if I'd get that technical about it. But yeah.
answer: Well, thank you for saying that.

question: You're welcome. Aren't you going to confess now?
answer: Confess what?

question: Nope. Then she smiles, only a teensy bit. Well, maybe about the love slaves. This is the first moment in a long time when the sisters share a smile. Drew turns to the Professor. Professor, I'm Drew MacLeod.
answer: Are you certain?

question: I wanted more than anything in the world to be a part of your program. I still do. But I failed. I didn't follow the rules. And honestly, before today, I didn't know how I was going to live with that. How to live with failure. I'm not good at it. I haven't done it much. But today I realized that I've lived in fear of it too long. I hope my application was a strong one and I came here today to ask your indulgence and to place my name back into consideration. If you won't, I'll understand. Better yet, I'll get over it. Maybe I shouldn't be in such a hurry after all. Maybe it would be best for me to just take this... Drew takes her DAYBOOK from Parker and drops it in the wastebasket. ... and lighten up. Parker looks horrified at the sight of Drew's daybook in the trash and fishes it out. Thanks for your time. Sorry if you missed your plane. He shakes her hand.
answer: It was worth it, I assure you. Now, could you clear up one thing for me? DREW/PARKER Sure. What's this about jail? CUT TO:

question: Hi, baby! Drew goes over to the truck. I was in the city. I tried to call you. Thought you might want a ride home.
answer: Sure.

question: Is that a new outfit?
answer: Yeah. Hey, one minute, 'kay?

question: Sure. Drew goes back to Jim.
answer: Thanks.

question: Thanks.
answer: You're welcome.

question: I, uh...
answer: You want to maybe... get together?

question: First I want to take a shower. For about a week. Drew leans over and kisses him on the cheek. Then she reaches into her bag and pulls out a card. Call me, okay?
answer: You have a card? Aren't you in high school? She smiles, shrugs and climbs in her dad's truck. They pull away, leaving Jim waving. When they're out of sight, Parker and Warren come back around the corner of the building.
